intro: Mendoncia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, range in color from white to pale blue.
